actions.committee: House Committee on Education and the Workforce
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Education and the Workforce
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Workforce Protections.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Education and the Workforce
actions.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Education and the Workforce
actions.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Education and the Workforce
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Education and the Workforce
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Reported by the Committee on Education and the Workforce. H. Rept. 105-446.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 254.
Placed on the Corrections Calendar, Calendar No. 5.
Called up from the Corrections Calendar for consideration.
Considered from the Corrections Calendar.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on the bill, the Speaker pro tempore put the question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Greenwood demanded the yeas and nays and the Speaker pro tempore announced that further proceedings would be postponed until later in the day.
Considered as unfinished business.
On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: (3/5 required): 408 - 0 (Roll No. 67).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on International Security.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported to Senate by Senator Thompson under the authority of the order of Jul 31, 98 without amendment. With written report No. 105-296.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 534.
Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.
Cleared for White House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 105-247.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on International Security, Proliferation and Federal Services

official_title: To correct a provision relating to termination of benefits for convicted persons.

summary.text: Amends Federal law concerning Government organization and employees to make a technical correction in the provision terminating receipt of Federal benefits for work injuries by certain convicted felons.

titles.title: To correct a provision relating to termination of benefits for convicted persons.
